content: stitch into both parts of the top v in the usual manner round 2 hdctbbo into each stitch half_double_crochet through back bar only the entire v comes forward and the back bar is located behind it round 3 half_double_crochet into each stitch into both parts of the top v in the usual manner round 4 increase round *sc8 sc2inc into next stitch repeat from * to eor 80 stitches section 3 linen stitch round 1 *sc1 ch1 sk1 repeat from * to eor rounds 2-5 *sc1 into next chain-1sp ch1 skip over single_crochet repeat from * to eor round 6 single_crochet into each single_crochet and chain-1sp to eor section 4 divider round 1 increase round *hdc8 hdc2 into next stitch repeat from * to eor 90 stitches round 2 hdctbbo into each stitch half_double_crochet through back bar only the entire v comes forward and the back bar is located behind it round 3 single_crochet into each stitch into both parts of the top v in the usual manner section 5 half_double_crochet v_stitch round 1 *hdc1 ch1 hdc1 into first stitch sk1 repeat from * to eor rounds 2-8 *hdc1 ch1 hdc1 into chain-1sp repeat from * to eor section 6 scallop border round 1 *sc1 dc3 sc1 into next chain-1sp sk1 stitch slip_stitch into next chain-1sp sk1 stitch repeat from * to last chain-1sp slip_stitch into that space secure tail weave in tails blocking and laundering soak the cowl for fifteen minutes in lukewarm water with a small amount of non-rinsing wool wash squeeze out excess water position the cowl on blocking mats or towel rearrange periodically to allow air to flow through and to avoid creasing please free to contact me with any questions dianelaugustin@mac com designed and knit by diane l augustin thank you to elizabeth for modeling copyright 2024 all rights reserved www yarnhappybeadhappy com www yarnhappybeadhappy etsy com http //www ravelry com/designers/diane-l-augustin
